Package swingtree

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Render.As<C extends javax.swing.JComponent,​E,​T extends E>
    This interface models the API of the Render builder which allows you to specify how a cell should be rendered.
    Render.Cell<C extends javax.swing.JComponent,​V>
    This interface models an individual table cell alongside various properties that a cell should have, like for example the value of the cell, its position within the table as well as a renderer in the form of a AWT Component which may or not be replaced or modified.
    Render.Cell.Interpreter<C extends javax.swing.JComponent,​V>
    An interface for interpreting the value of a Render.Cell and setting a Component or custom renderer which is then used to render the cell.
    WindowDelegate<W extends java.awt.Window,​E>
    A delegate for any kind of Swing window, usually a JFrame or a JDialog, which is passed to the event handlers in the SwingTree API.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ComponentDelegate<C extends javax.swing.JComponent,​E>
    Instances of this are delegates for a specific components and events that are passed to user event action handlers (see Action), with the purpose of providing useful context information to the action handler.
    ComponentDragEventDelegate<C extends javax.swing.JComponent>
    A JComponent and MouseEvent delegate providing useful context information to various Action listeners used by UIForAnySwing.onMouseDrag(Action) like for example the ComponentMouseEventDelegate.mouseX() and ComponentMouseEventDelegate.mouseY() of the event as well as more drag specific information like ComponentDragEventDelegate.dragEvents() and ComponentDragEventDelegate.dragPositions().
    ComponentMouseEventDelegate<C extends javax.swing.JComponent>
    A JComponent delegate providing useful context information to various Action listeners used by UIForAnySwing.onMouseClick(sprouts.Action)}, UIForAnySwing.onMousePress(sprouts.Action) and UIForAnySwing.onMouseRelease(sprouts.Action), for example.
    OptionalUI<C extends java.awt.Component>
    A container object for AWT Component types which may or may not contain a non-null value.
    Render<C extends javax.swing.JComponent,​E>
    An API for building extensions of the DefaultTableCellRenderer in a functional style.
    Render.Builder<C extends javax.swing.JComponent,​E>
    A builder for building simple customized TableCellRenderer!
    SplitButtonDelegate<I extends javax.swing.JMenuItem>  
    SplitItem<I extends javax.swing.JMenuItem>
    An immutable data carrier exposing everything needed to configure an item of a JSplitButton.
    SplitItem.Delegate<I extends javax.swing.JMenuItem>
    Instances of this are exposed as delegates through the ComponentDelegate passed to the actions supplied to SplitItem.onSelection(Action) in order to give said actions all the necessary context they need to perform whatever action they so desire.
    SwingTree
    A SwingTree is a singleton that holds global configuration context for the SwingTree library.
    SwingTree.UIScale
    This class handles scaling in Swing UIs.
    Tab
    An immutable data carrier exposing everything needed to configure a tab of a JTabbedPane.
    TabDelegate
    A JTabbedPane delegate providing useful context information to various Action listeners used by UIForTabbedPane.onTabMouseClick(Action), UIForTabbedPane.onTabMousePress(Action) and UIForTabbedPane.onTabMouseRelease(Action), for example.
    UI
    This class is a static API for exposing swing tree builder types for wrapping and assembling various JComponent types to form a UI tree.

    UIForAnyButton<I,​B extends javax.swing.AbstractButton>
    The following is a more specialized type of builder node based on the UIForAnySwing builder type, and provides additional features associated with the more specialized AbstractButton" Swing component type.
    UIForAnyEditorPane<I,​C extends javax.swing.JEditorPane>  
    UIForAnyMenuItem<I,​M extends javax.swing.JMenuItem>  
    UIForAnySwing<I,​C extends javax.swing.JComponent>
    A swing tree builder node for any kind JComponent instance.
    UIForAnyTextComponent<I,​C extends javax.swing.text.JTextComponent>
    A swing tree builder node for JTextComponent instances.
    UIForAnyTextComponent.AbstractDelegate  
    UIForAnyTextComponent.InsertDelegate  
    UIForAnyTextComponent.RemoveDelegate  
    UIForAnyTextComponent.ReplaceDelegate  
    UIForAnything<T extends java.awt.Component>
    A swing tree builder node for anything.
    UIForAnyToggleButton<I,​B extends javax.swing.JToggleButton>
    An abstract precursor for swing tree builder nodes for JToggleButton instances.
    UIForAnyWindow<I extends UIForAnyWindow<I,​W>,​W extends java.awt.Window>  
    UIForBox<B extends JBox>
    A swing tree builder node for JBox instances.
    UIForButton<B extends javax.swing.AbstractButton>
    A swing tree builder node for AbstractButton sub-type instances, usually the JButton type.
    UIForCheckBox<B extends javax.swing.JCheckBox>
    A swing tree builder node for JCheckBox instances.
    UIForCheckBoxMenuItem<M extends javax.swing.JCheckBoxMenuItem>  
    UIForCombo<E,​C extends javax.swing.JComboBox<E>>
    A swing tree builder node for JComboBox instances.
    UIForEditorPane<P extends javax.swing.JEditorPane>
    A swing tree builder node for JEditorPane instances.
    UIForFormattedTextField  
    UIForIcon<I extends JIcon>
    A UIForAnySwing subclass specifically designed for adding icons to your SwingTree.

    UIForScrollPane<P extends javax.swing.JScrollPane>
    A swing tree builder node for JScrollPane instances.
    UIForScrollPanels<P extends JScrollPanels>
    A builder node for JScrollPanels a custom Swing-Tree component which is similar to a JList but with the ability to interact with the individual components in the list.
    UIForSeparator<S extends javax.swing.JSeparator>
    A swing tree builder node for JSeparator instances.

    A swing tree builder node for JSplitPane instances.
    UIForSwing<C extends javax.swing.JComponent>
    A swing tree builder node for JComponent types.
    UIForTabbedPane<P extends javax.swing.JTabbedPane>
    A swing tree builder node for JTabbedPane instances.
    UIForTable<T extends javax.swing.JTable>
    A swing tree builder node for JTable instances allowing for a fluent API to build tables in a declarative way.

  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    UI.Active
    A general purpose enum describing if something is never, always or sometimes active.
    UI.Align
    Vertical or horizontal alignment.
    UI.Alignment
    The logical combination of a vertical and horizontal alignment.
    UI.Axis  
    UI.Corner
    Use this in the style API (see UIForAnySwing.withStyle(Styler)) to target specific corners of a JComponent and apply custom Style properties to them.
    UI.Cursor
    An enum set of all the available swing cursors which map to the cursor type id.
    UI.Edge
    Use this to target specific edges of a JComponent and apply custom Style properties to them.
    UI.GradientType
    Use these enum instances to specify the gradient type for various sub styles, like for example BaseStyle or BorderStyle through the GradientStyle.type(GradientType) method exposed by methods like ComponentStyleDelegate.gradient(String, Function) or ComponentStyleDelegate.borderGradient(String, Function).
    UI.HorizontalAlignment
    Different positions along a horizontally aligned UI component.
    UI.Layer
    Instances of this enum are used to configure onto which layer a particular style configuration should be applied.
    UI.ListData  
    UI.MapData  
    UI.OverflowPolicy
    Overflow policy of UI components.
    UI.Placement
    Use this to specify the placement of an image as part of the ImageStyle through the ImageStyle.placement(Placement) method exposed by the style API (see UIForAnySwing.withStyle(Styler)).
    UI.Position
    The position of a UI component in terms of directions.
    UI.Transition
    Use these enum instances to specify the gradient alignment for various sub styles, like for example BaseStyle or BorderStyle through the GradientStyle.transition(Transition) method exposed by methods like ComponentStyleDelegate.gradient(String, Function) or ComponentStyleDelegate.borderGradient(String, Function).
    UI.VerticalAlignment
    Different positions along a vertically aligned UI component.
